Visiting planets and finding easter eggs is neat and all, but once you've visited most of the planets and found most of the easter eggs, it gets repetitive.

The procedure for visiting each planet is basically the same, just with varying amounts of delta-V (a bigger rocket, or mid-space refueling, depending on your computer speed) for harder planets. Easter eggs provide a place to go, but ultimately they're just meaningless 3D models with no impact on the outcome of the mission.

I'm hoping the career mode will include genuinely unique challenges with practical rewards.

Imagine if your space program had a limited budget and every launch or failure cost you big money. Then one of your satellites discovered a deposit of melon-sized diamonds on the north pole of Ike, and you had to design a system of ships, stations or rovers to recover them, on a budget. Bringing the diamonds back would allow you to develop new technology to take on even harder and more lucrative challenges. Now -that- would be an fascinating challenge with actual consequences.
